cards.title: Street talk / Graffiti slogans around the world

item.title: Street talk: graffiti slogans around the world
item.trailText: The book Street Messages by artist and photographer Nicholas Ganz documents street-art slogans worldwide, from Norway to Guatemala City
item.standFirst:
The street artist and photographer Nicholas Ganz made his name with his best-selling book Graffiti World, the first to chronicle street art from around the globe. This gallery features his new book Street Messages, documenting street-art slogans from Norway to Guatemala City

• Ganz will be speaking on 2 June at the book launch, Graffiti Messages, at the Lazarides gallery in London

displayImages.caption:
Dolk
Dolk is Norwegian, and he did this in the north of Norway in a really rural area.
I wanted to caption graffiti writing - everything from political messages, to random words, to poems. Most of the artists sent me their work. I’d miss things If I went out searching myself.
All photographs: Dokument Press
displayImages.altText: Artwork by Dolk
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Dolk
Dolk is Norwegian, and he did this in the north of Norway in a really rural area.
I wanted to caption graffiti writing - everything from political messages, to random words, to poems. Most of the artists sent me their work. I’d miss things If I went out searching myself.
All photographs: Dokument Press

displayImages.caption:
Megan Wilson
She is from America, and makes political works about capitalism and the gentrification of cities.
displayImages.altText: "Capitalism is Over" by artist: Megan Wilson from Street Messages.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Megan Wilson
She is from America, and makes political works about capitalism and the gentrification of cities.

displayImages.caption:
Canvaz
Many graffiti artists do their work to make people smile a bit. This is in a small village in Ireland.
displayImages.altText: "Smile" by artist, Canvaz from Street Messages.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Canvaz
Many graffiti artists do their work to make people smile a bit. This is in a small village in Ireland.

displayImages.caption:
Visual Pollution by Mobstr
Mobstr is British, and here he’s playing with advertising images and slogans. Mobstr’s point is that people complain about youth culture and graffiti, but not about the ugliest graffiti in the world which is advertising.
displayImages.altText: "Visual Pollution" artist: Mobstr  from Street Messages.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Visual Pollution by Mobstr
Mobstr is British, and here he’s playing with advertising images and slogans. Mobstr’s point is that people complain about youth culture and graffiti, but not about the ugliest graffiti in the world which is advertising.

displayImages.caption:
Stick to the Plan by Kid Acne
Kid Acne used to write his name but got bored of that, and replaced his name with slogans. Sometimes they are local aphorisms or slang words, and often they are connected with the place he’s working in.
displayImages.altText: Kid Acne
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Stick to the Plan by Kid Acne
Kid Acne used to write his name but got bored of that, and replaced his name with slogans. Sometimes they are local aphorisms or slang words, and often they are connected with the place he’s working in.

displayImages.caption:
Jay Shells
He takes extracts from hip-hop songs, makes a sign and puts the lyrics into the area the artist was singing about.
displayImages.altText: Artist: Jay Shells
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Jay Shells
He takes extracts from hip-hop songs, makes a sign and puts the lyrics into the area the artist was singing about.

displayImages.caption:
Dolk
This is from the same trip Dolk was on in the fjords of Norway – a very rural, harsh area with a lot of pretty nature.
displayImages.altText: The Coast is Clear by artist, Dolk from Street Messages.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Dolk
This is from the same trip Dolk was on in the fjords of Norway – a very rural, harsh area with a lot of pretty nature.

displayImages.caption:
John Fekner
He is one of the pioneers of text graffiti. He lives in New York and travels around the world making art. He is a pioneer of writing only text in the street, mostly connected to social, political and environmental ideas.
displayImages.altText: John Fekner
displayImages.cleanCaption:
John Fekner
He is one of the pioneers of text graffiti. He lives in New York and travels around the world making art. He is a pioneer of writing only text in the street, mostly connected to social, political and environmental ideas.

displayImages.caption:
McDonalds by the Billboard Liberation Front
They are from San Francisco Bay area and they are part of the ad-busting movement. They cut out words and replace them with other words so the advert gets a different meaning.
displayImages.altText: McDonalds by artists: Billboard Liberation Front from StreetMessages.
displayImages.cleanCaption:
McDonalds by the Billboard Liberation Front
They are from San Francisco Bay area and they are part of the ad-busting movement. They cut out words and replace them with other words so the advert gets a different meaning.

displayImages.caption:
Things You’ll Never Find in a Black Market by Escif
He is a Spanish artist who dedicates his work to text, sometimes big messages, sometimes small. This one was spray painted on the snow.
displayImages.altText: Escif
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Things You’ll Never Find in a Black Market by Escif
He is a Spanish artist who dedicates his work to text, sometimes big messages, sometimes small. This one was spray painted on the snow.

displayImages.caption:
Signor G
He is from Tel Aviv and writes messages connected to the political situation in Israel.
displayImages.altText: Signor G
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Signor G
He is from Tel Aviv and writes messages connected to the political situation in Israel.

displayImages.caption:
Above
He is American, but he lives in Berlin. This was done in Guatemala City. I like the comment because graffiti is so temporary. And it’s rare to have a graffiti image from Guatemala. People don’t seem to do much graffiti there.
displayImages.altText: Above
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Above
He is American, but he lives in Berlin. This was done in Guatemala City. I like the comment because graffiti is so temporary. And it’s rare to have a graffiti image from Guatemala. People don’t seem to do much graffiti there.

displayImages.caption:
Skki
He’s a pioneer of the graffiti movement in Paris. He makes very harsh, direct messages about cultural issues. This image speaks for itself.
displayImages.altText: Skki
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Skki
He’s a pioneer of the graffiti movement in Paris. He makes very harsh, direct messages about cultural issues. This image speaks for itself.

cards.title: Russia / Travel ban imposed on 89 EU politicians
cards.rawTitle: Travel ban imposed on 89 EU politicians

item.title: Russia imposes travel ban on 89 EU politicians - video report
item.trailText: Russia has imposed an entry ban on 89 European politicians and military leaders
item.standFirst: Russia has imposed an entry ban on 89 European politicians and military leaders, a move that has angered Europe and worsened Russia's standoff with the west over Moscow's role in the Ukraine conflict. Many of the figures reportedly included on the list have previously spoken out against the Kremlin. Britain's former foreign secretary and former deputy prime minister Nick Clegg are among the named individuals

cards.title: The FA Cup final / Arsenal v Aston Villa

item.title: The 2015 FA Cup final: Arsenal v Aston Villa
item.trailText: Our photographer was at Wembley as Arsenal demolished Aston Villa to win the FA Cup for a record 12th time
item.standFirst:
Our photographer was at Wembley as Arsenal demolished Aston Villa 4-0 to win the FA Cup for a record 12th time

  • ‘Cazorla grabbed my camera … and this is what I found’

displayImages.caption: Fans make their way to the stadium from the tube station
displayImages.altText: Fans make their way to the stadium from the tube station.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Fans make their way to the stadium from the tube station

displayImages.caption: Though this Villa fan arrived via a more luxurious mode of transport. Wonder if it’s Prince William’s car?
displayImages.altText: Though this Villa fan arrived via a more luxuriouss mode of transport.  Wonder if it's Prince William's car?
displayImages.cleanCaption: Though this Villa fan arrived via a more luxurious mode of transport. Wonder if it’s Prince William’s car?

displayImages.caption: Villa fans with masks.
displayImages.altText: Villa fans with masks
displayImages.cleanCaption: Villa fans with masks.

displayImages.caption: Inside the ground the Villa fans are enjoying themselves before kick-off.
displayImages.altText: Inside the ground the Villa fans are enjoying themselves ahead of kick-off
displayImages.cleanCaption: Inside the ground the Villa fans are enjoying themselves before kick-off.

displayImages.caption: The two teams line up.
displayImages.altText: The two teams line up
displayImages.cleanCaption: The two teams line up.

displayImages.caption: The band before they play the National Anthem, which was sung by Alfie Boe.
displayImages.altText: The band before they play the National Anthem, which was sung by Alfie Boe
displayImages.cleanCaption: The band before they play the National Anthem, which was sung by Alfie Boe.

displayImages.caption: Santi Cazorla is dispossessed by Ashley Westwood as Arsenal have the better of the early stages.
displayImages.altText: Santi Cazorla is dispossessed by Ashley Westwood as Arsenal have the better of the early stages
displayImages.cleanCaption: Santi Cazorla is dispossessed by Ashley Westwood as Arsenal have the better of the early stages.

displayImages.caption: Aston Villa keeper Shay Given flaps at an Arsenal cross.
displayImages.altText: Aston Villa keeper Shay Given flaps at an Arsenal cross
displayImages.cleanCaption: Aston Villa keeper Shay Given flaps at an Arsenal cross.

displayImages.caption: Westwood controls the ball as Alexis Sánchez and Tom Cleverley look on.
displayImages.altText: Ashley Westwood controls the ball as Sanchez and Tom Cleverley look on
displayImages.cleanCaption: Westwood controls the ball as Alexis Sánchez and Tom Cleverley look on.

displayImages.caption: Kieran Richardson attempts to block Héctor Bellerín’s cross.
displayImages.altText: Richardson attempts to block Bellerin's cross
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kieran Richardson attempts to block Héctor Bellerín’s cross.

displayImages.caption: Sánchez uses a bit of fancy control to wrong foot Cleverley.
displayImages.altText: Alexis Sanchez uses a bit of fancy control to wrong foot Tom Cleverley
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sánchez uses a bit of fancy control to wrong foot Cleverley.

displayImages.caption: Five minutes before half-time Arsenal get the lead that their pressure deserved. Sánchez rises above Villa’s unconvincing centre-halves, heading back across for Theo Walcott, who enters the area from the left and thwacks a blistering volley into the net.
displayImages.altText: Five minutes before half-time Arsenal get the lead that their pressure deserved. Alexis Sanchez rises above Villa’s unconvincing centre halves, heading back across for Theo Walcott, who enters the area from the left and thwacks a blistering volley into the net
displayImages.cleanCaption: Five minutes before half-time Arsenal get the lead that their pressure deserved. Sánchez rises above Villa’s unconvincing centre-halves, heading back across for Theo Walcott, who enters the area from the left and thwacks a blistering volley into the net.

displayImages.caption: Five minutes after half-time Arsenal double their lead when Sánchez, 30 yards out down the inside-left channel, drops a shoulder to move inside, then unleashes a swerving, rising shot that deceives Given and whips into the roof of the net.
displayImages.altText: Five minutes after hafl-time Arsenal double their lead when Sanchez, 30 yards out down the inside-left channel, drops a shoulder to move inside, then unleashes a crazy, swerving, rising shot that deceives Given and whips into the roof of the net
displayImages.cleanCaption: Five minutes after half-time Arsenal double their lead when Sánchez, 30 yards out down the inside-left channel, drops a shoulder to move inside, then unleashes a swerving, rising shot that deceives Given and whips into the roof of the net.

displayImages.caption: Sánchez wheels away ...
displayImages.altText: Sanchez wheels away ...
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sánchez wheels away ...

displayImages.caption: Then a huge leap and a grin shows he’s rather pleased with that finish, and so he should be, it was rather fabulous.
displayImages.altText: Then a huge leap and a huge grim shows he's rather pleased with that finish, and so he should be, it was rather fabulous
displayImages.cleanCaption: Then a huge leap and a grin shows he’s rather pleased with that finish, and so he should be, it was rather fabulous.

displayImages.caption: Being two goals to the good and with such a dominant performance the Arsenal fans are sure that the FA Cup will be staying at the Emirates.
displayImages.altText: Being two goals to the good and with such a dominant performance the Arsenal fans are sure that the FA Cup will be staying at the Emirates
displayImages.cleanCaption: Being two goals to the good and with such a dominant performance the Arsenal fans are sure that the FA Cup will be staying at the Emirates.

displayImages.caption: Make that three goals to the good, as just after the hour mark, a corner comes in, Per Mertesacker rises, and carefully plants a header into the net.
displayImages.altText: Make that three goals to the good, as just after the hour mark, a corner comes in, Mertesacker rises, and carefully plants a header into the net
displayImages.cleanCaption: Make that three goals to the good, as just after the hour mark, a corner comes in, Per Mertesacker rises, and carefully plants a header into the net.

displayImages.altText: Pers Mertesacker acknowledges the celebrating Gooners
displayImages.cleanCaption: Mertesacker acknowledges the celebrating Gooners.

displayImages.caption: That third goal was the signal for this Arsenal fan to adorn his carefully painted FA Cup trophy with the Arsenal ribbons.
displayImages.altText: That third goal was the signal for this Arsenal fan to adorn his carefully painted FA Cup trophy with the Arsenal ribbons
displayImages.cleanCaption: That third goal was the signal for this Arsenal fan to adorn his carefully painted FA Cup trophy with the Arsenal ribbons.

displayImages.caption: Christian Benteke had a quiet game and wasn’t able to help Villa get back into the match.
displayImages.altText: Christian Benteke had a quiet game and wasn't able to help Villa get back into the match
displayImages.cleanCaption: Christian Benteke had a quiet game and wasn’t able to help Villa get back into the match.

displayImages.caption: Jack Wilshere, Gabriel Agbonlahor and Francis Coquelin tussle for the ball
displayImages.altText: Jack Wilshere, Gabriel Agbonlahor and Coquelin tussle for the ball
displayImages.cleanCaption: Jack Wilshere, Gabriel Agbonlahor and Francis Coquelin tussle for the ball

displayImages.caption: The Villa fans wait for the final whistle to put them out of their misery. However their humiliation is complete during injury time when Olivier Giroud turns in Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain’s shot to make it Arsenal 4-0 Aston Villa.
displayImages.altText: The Villa fans wait for the final whistle to put them out of their misery
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Villa fans wait for the final whistle to put them out of their misery. However their humiliation is complete during injury time when Olivier Giroud turns in Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain’s shot to make it Arsenal 4-0 Aston Villa.

displayImages.caption: The final whistle goes and Arsenal have won the FA Cup for a record 12th time.
displayImages.altText: The final whistle goes and Arsenal have won the FA Cup for a record 12th time
displayImages.cleanCaption: The final whistle goes and Arsenal have won the FA Cup for a record 12th time.

displayImages.caption: Jack Grealish’s posture says it all.
displayImages.altText: Jack Grealish's posture says it all
displayImages.cleanCaption: Jack Grealish’s posture says it all.

displayImages.caption: As does that of Villa’s manager Tim Sherwood.
displayImages.altText: As does that of Villa boss Tim Sherwood
displayImages.cleanCaption: As does that of Villa’s manager Tim Sherwood.

displayImages.caption: As the Arsenal players celebrate just after the final whistle, Cazorla proves that he’s a better footballer than photographer when he grabs Tom Jenkins’ remote camera to take some selfies of himself and his team-mates.
displayImages.altText: As the Arsenal players celebrate just after the final whistle, Santi Cazorla proves that he’s a better footballer than photographer when he grabs Tom Jenkins’ remote camera to take some selfies of himself and his team-mates
displayImages.cleanCaption: As the Arsenal players celebrate just after the final whistle, Cazorla proves that he’s a better footballer than photographer when he grabs Tom Jenkins’ remote camera to take some selfies of himself and his team-mates.

displayImages.caption: Though his picture of the celebrating Arsenal fans is at least in focus.
displayImages.altText: Though his picture of the celebrating Arsenal fans is at least in focus
displayImages.cleanCaption: Though his picture of the celebrating Arsenal fans is at least in focus.

displayImages.caption: Aaron Ramsey, left, shows Cazorla how it’s done when he has a go at a selfie.
displayImages.altText: Aaron Ramsey, left, shows Santi Cazorla how it's done when he has a go at a selfie
displayImages.cleanCaption: Aaron Ramsey, left, shows Cazorla how it’s done when he has a go at a selfie.

displayImages.caption: Arsène Wenger is all smiles as the winners wait to go up the steps to the Royal Box
displayImages.altText: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger is all smiles as the winners wait to go up the steps to the Royal Box
displayImages.cleanCaption: Arsène Wenger is all smiles as the winners wait to go up the steps to the Royal Box

displayImages.caption: Finally the time arrives and the Arsenal fans try to get near their heroes as they climb the stairs to the Royal Box to collect the trophy.
displayImages.altText: Finally the time arrives and the Arsenal fans try to get near their heroes as they climb the stairs to the Royal Box to collect the trophy
displayImages.cleanCaption: Finally the time arrives and the Arsenal fans try to get near their heroes as they climb the stairs to the Royal Box to collect the trophy.

displayImages.caption: Aston Villa fan Prince William congratulates Mertesacker. The German is performing the captain’s duties while Mikel Arteta is out injured.
displayImages.altText: Aston Villa fan Prince William congratulates Arsenal captain Pers Mertesacker.  The German is performing the captain's duties whilst Mikel Arteta is out injured
displayImages.cleanCaption: Aston Villa fan Prince William congratulates Mertesacker. The German is performing the captain’s duties while Mikel Arteta is out injured.

displayImages.caption: Mertesacker and Arteta, who is doing a ‘John Terry’ by donning his kit during the trophy ceremony, hoist the FA Cup high amid the celebrating Arsenal players.
displayImages.altText: Mertesacker and Arteta, who is doing a 'John Terry' by donning his kit during the trophy ceremony, hoist the FA Cup high amid the celebrating Arsenal players
displayImages.cleanCaption: Mertesacker and Arteta, who is doing a ‘John Terry’ by donning his kit during the trophy ceremony, hoist the FA Cup high amid the celebrating Arsenal players.

displayImages.caption: Now it’s Wenger’s turn to get his hands on the trophy.
displayImages.altText: Now it's Arsene Wenger's turn to get his hands on the trophy
displayImages.cleanCaption: Now it’s Wenger’s turn to get his hands on the trophy.

displayImages.caption: Once the players are back on the pitch the celebrations can begin in earnest.
displayImages.altText: Once the players are back on the pitch the celebrations can begin in earnest

cards.title: Liz Kendall / Taking the safe option won't cut it for Labour
cards.rawTitle: Taking the safe option won't cut it for Labour

item.title: Liz Kendall: Taking the safe option won't cut it for Labour
item.trailText: Liz Kendall: Taking the safe option won't cut it for Labour
item.standFirst: Speaking on Friday from Leicester, Labour party leadership candidate, Liz Kendall, says the magnitude of Labour's defeat in the general election means taking the safe option and repeating the remedies of the past will not be sufficient for a Labour come-back. Kendall declared her candidacy on 10 May

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Liz Kendall: Taking the safe option wont cut it for Labour - video Photograph: guardian.co.uk
stillImage.altText: 620x372 trailpic for Liz Kendall: Taking the safe option wont cut it for Labour - video

displayImages.altText: 620x372 trailpic for Liz Kendall: Taking the safe option wont cut it for Labour - video

item.title: Alice Smeets's Ghetto Tarot
item.trailText: Shooting a witchcraft workshop in England gave Belgian photographer Alice Smeets the idea for a new approach to photographing Haiti, a country she has documented since 2007
item.standFirst: Shooting a witchcraft workshop in England gave Belgian photographer Alice Smeets the idea for a new approach to photographing Haiti, a country she has documented since 2007. “I was slightly disillusioned about my documentary work and hoping my pictures would contribute to change,” she explains. So she teamed up with Haitian artists from the group Atis Rezistans (resistant artists) to create the Ghetto Tarot, a modern interpretation of the 1910 Rider-Waite tarot deck, to show Port-au-Prince in a different light. “For them, ghetto means community, family, union,” Smeets says. “So when Haitians say ghetto, they say it very proudly.” For more information, click here.

displayImages.caption: The suit of wands is understood to represent both the element of fire and the “third estate” of society: those with the least power in the social hierarchy of the middle ages. In combining the nurturing qualities of the Queen with the fire of the suit of wands, the Queen of Wands is understood to represent strength, fiery intensity and warmth.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: Queen of Wands
displayImages.cleanCaption: The suit of wands is understood to represent both the element of fire and the “third estate” of society: those with the least power in the social hierarchy of the middle ages. In combining the nurturing qualities of the Queen with the fire of the suit of wands, the Queen of Wands is understood to represent strength, fiery intensity and warmth.

displayImages.caption: After conflict shown on the Five of Wands, the Six of Wands, depicting a man on horseback, is understood to represent mobilisation, as he seems to be rallying people – perhaps the previously sparring men from the Five of Wands. The wreath on his head symbolises victory and success.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Six of Wands
displayImages.cleanCaption: After conflict shown on the Five of Wands, the Six of Wands, depicting a man on horseback, is understood to represent mobilisation, as he seems to be rallying people – perhaps the previously sparring men from the Five of Wands. The wreath on his head symbolises victory and success.

displayImages.caption: The several versions of the Ace of Wands have given rise to a number of interpretations. For Waite, the scholar and mystic behind the popular Rider-Waite tarot deck, the card signifies creation.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: Ace of Wands.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The several versions of the Ace of Wands have given rise to a number of interpretations. For Waite, the scholar and mystic behind the popular Rider-Waite tarot deck, the card signifies creation.

displayImages.caption: The King of Swords is often seen to represent an intellectual, sometimes ruthless man.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: King of Swords.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The King of Swords is often seen to represent an intellectual, sometimes ruthless man.

displayImages.caption: The Nine of Swords depicts a woman sitting up in bed as if woken from a nightmare, with her fears – in this case, swords – floating above her.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Nine of Swords.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Nine of Swords depicts a woman sitting up in bed as if woken from a nightmare, with her fears – in this case, swords – floating above her.

displayImages.caption: For Waite, the Hermit alone with a lantern represented solitude and introspection.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Hermit
displayImages.cleanCaption: For Waite, the Hermit alone with a lantern represented solitude and introspection.

displayImages.caption: A man lying on a tomb, the Four of Swords is understood to depict peaceful reflection, rather than death.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: Four of Swords.
displayImages.cleanCaption: A man lying on a tomb, the Four of Swords is understood to depict peaceful reflection, rather than death.

displayImages.caption: The Fool, in the Rider-Waite deck, depicts a young man walking absent-mindedly toward a precipice.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Fool.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Fool, in the Rider-Waite deck, depicts a young man walking absent-mindedly toward a precipice.

displayImages.caption: The Star depicts shows a naked woman pouring water into a pool of water and on to the land, with stars above her. The card is often associated with tranquility and regeneration. For Waite, it symbolised perpetual creation.
displayImages.altText: The Star Ghetto Tarot
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Star depicts shows a naked woman pouring water into a pool of water and on to the land, with stars above her. The card is often associated with tranquility and regeneration. For Waite, it symbolised perpetual creation.

displayImages.caption: The Sun card is seen to be a positive one, with an anthropomorphised sun shining down on a child. For Waite, the card represented attained knowledge; a nod to how discovery renews human innocence.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Sun.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Sun card is seen to be a positive one, with an anthropomorphised sun shining down on a child. For Waite, the card represented attained knowledge; a nod to how discovery renews human innocence.

displayImages.caption: The Five of Cups signifies loss: the cloaked figure is seen to be almost literally “crying over spilt milk”. In focusing on his loss (three spilt cups), he is unaware of the good that remains (two cups still stand). As such, the card can be understood to represent not appreciating what we have.  Photograph: Alice Smeets
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Five of Cups
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Five of Cups signifies loss: the cloaked figure is seen to be almost literally “crying over spilt milk”. In focusing on his loss (three spilt cups), he is unaware of the good that remains (two cups still stand). As such, the card can be understood to represent not appreciating what we have.

displayImages.caption: The Magician card of the Rider-Waite deck represents eternity, as symbolised by the infinity sign above the Magician’s head.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Magician.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Magician card of the Rider-Waite deck represents eternity, as symbolised by the infinity sign above the Magician’s head.

displayImages.caption: In depicting a man walking away from the viewer, the Eight of Cups is understood to represent a break with the present, turning away from disillusionment to seek fulfilment elsewhere.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: Eight of Cups.
displayImages.cleanCaption: In depicting a man walking away from the viewer, the Eight of Cups is understood to represent a break with the present, turning away from disillusionment to seek fulfilment elsewhere.

displayImages.caption: The Death card depicts a skeleton on horseback riding across a land strewn with the bodies of dead or dying people from across the social hierarchy – from kings to paupers – perhaps signifying how in death, we are all equal; or, that death comes for us all.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: Death.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Death card depicts a skeleton on horseback riding across a land strewn with the bodies of dead or dying people from across the social hierarchy – from kings to paupers – perhaps signifying how in death, we are all equal; or, that death comes for us all.

displayImages.caption: As Waite pointed out, the Hanged Man does not seem to be suffering, but seems entranced. He suggested that the card thus represents the relationship “between the divine and the universe”.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: The Hanged Man
displayImages.cleanCaption: As Waite pointed out, the Hanged Man does not seem to be suffering, but seems entranced. He suggested that the card thus represents the relationship “between the divine and the universe”.

displayImages.caption: The Nine of Cups is understood to symbolise contentment, satisfaction, and achievement of desires.
displayImages.altText: Ghetto Tarot: Cups.
displayImages.cleanCaption: The Nine of Cups is understood to symbolise contentment, satisfaction, and achievement of desires.

cards.title: BB King / Mississippi bids musical farewell to a blues legend
cards.rawTitle: Mississippi bids musical farewell to a blues legend

item.title: Mississippi bids musical farewell to blues legend BB King - video report
item.trailText: Hundreds of mourners gather in Indianola, Mississippi on Saturday to bid farewell to legendary blues giant BB King
item.standFirst: Hundreds of mourners gather in Indianola, Mississippi on Saturday to bid farewell to legendary blues giant BB King. The funeral service was held at Bell Grove Baptist Church and the casket was accompanied by his beloved custom-made guitar, Lucille. The 15-time Grammy winner and member of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame was ranked by Rolling Stone Magazine as No. 6 on its 2011 list of the 100 greatest guitarists

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for BB King Photograph: guardian.co.uk

displayImages.caption: 620x372 trailpic for BB King Photograph: guardian.co.uk
displayImages.altText: 620x372 trailpic for BB King
displayImages.cleanCaption: 620x372 trailpic for BB King
